alert.note: Alert for Chaves; Curry; De Baca; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 3:50PM MDT until May 27 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern De Baca County in east central New Mexico... Northeastern Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico... Southwestern Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 349 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 25 miles east of Mesa to 8 miles west of Elkins to 13 miles northeast of Bottomless Lakes State Park, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Elida, Elkins and Kenna. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 358 and 361. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 172 and 200. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms are producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
